Title: Experienced Prompt Engineer and Python Developer for AI-Powered Knowledge Retrieval System
Est. Time:
Est. time:
     1 to 3 months, Less than 30 hrs/week
Description:
We are seeking an experienced prompt engineer and Python developer to create an AI-powered knowledge retrieval and evaluation system that leverages multiple language models. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience crafting effective prompts, working with the OpenAI API, and designing systems that facilitate seamless interaction between LLMs.

Project Scope:
- Implement an AI-powered knowledge retrieval and evaluation system using ChatGPT, Claude, and the OpenAI Assistants API
- Develop highly effective prompts for the Responder and Discriminator LLMs to ensure optimal performance
- Design and implement a system that allows for smooth interaction between the LLMs and enables monitoring and control of each step
- Optimize the system for performance, scalability, and user experience

Required Skills and Experience:
- Proven track record of using prompt engineering to create tools, solve complex problems, and optimize LLM performance
- Deep understanding of ChatGPT, Claude, and the OpenAI Assistants API (Retrieval, Threads, Runs)
- Strong coding skills in Python and experience with the Streamlit library
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to overcome challenges
- Strong communication skills and ability to work independently

Application Process:
1. Submit your resume and portfolio showcasing relevant projects and experience in prompt engineering and OpenAI API integration.
2. Answer the custom questions provided on the Upwork platform, demonstrating your technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and ability to provide detailed, reflective responses.
3. To demonstrate your attention to detail and commitment to this project, please include a sample prompt that you have engineered for an LLM to perform a specific task related to knowledge retrieval or evaluation. Submit this sample prompt as a separate document alongside your application.
4. Participate in a technical interview to further demonstrate your problem-solving abilities, creative thinking, and communication skills.
5. Sign an NDA before receiving the full project details and scope.

Screening Questions:
1. Describe a specific problem you've encountered in your daily life and how you would design an AI solution to address it. Provide details on the problem, the proposed solution, and your implementation approach.
2. Share your experience integrating the OpenAI Assistants API in a project. What challenges did you face with features like Retrieval, Threads, or Runs, and how did you overcome them?
3. Reflect on a time when a prompt engineering solution you designed did not perform as expected. What assumptions did you make, how did the outcome differ, and how did you adapt your approach?
4. In your opinion, what is the most pressing ethical issue facing the development of language models today? Explain your stance and how you believe this issue should be addressed.
5. Provide a link to a portfolio or documentation of an AI-powered system you developed. Describe your specific contributions and the challenges you faced in delivering the solution.

Timeline:
- Deliver a working prototype within 1 week of project kickoff
- Complete the fully functional and optimized system within the agreed-upon timeline (to be discussed during the interview process)
- Provide comprehensive documentation, including system architecture, code structure, and instructions for future maintenance

Candidates who provide thoughtful, detailed responses to the custom questions and include a relevant, well-crafted sample prompt will be given priority in the application review process.

If our team is satisfied with your work on this project, we will consider you for future projects involving prompt engineering and AI-powered systems.

For additional context and examples of the desired system architecture and functionality, please review the following resources:
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qHPonmSX4Ms.  --- you must know EVERYTHING from this video
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TpMIssRdhco.  --- you must understand this concept and demonstrate how i can be used in chatGPT context
We look forward to reviewing your application and finding the right candidate to bring this innovative project to life!

Title: Seeking consultant to tell us how to use AI to help write branded emails for our clients (1 hour)
Est. Time: N/A
Description:
Hello!

We are a medium-sized paid ads and email marketing agency.

We are looking to streamline our email copy-writing (especially for our automated flows).

Currently, we have templated copy structures for all of our automated emails for every client we take on. We manually use theses structures and some example text to write new copy for each new client... applying their brand voice and product features and benefits, etc.

Although we have streamlined the copy-writing process greatly, we know that with AI technology it is probably possible to more quickly write the copy for new clients because we already know the structure to follow (following our strategy and examples) and the brand voice of the client.

What we do not know is what tool or process we should look into. Does a tool already exist for this? Or is it worth developing our own mini-tool?

Our goal, in a nutshell, is to provide an AI tool with these main inputs:

1. The structure/strategy of each email we need to make (headline, subheadline, body text, CTA, etc. etc. - it is different based on the email)
2. Possibly example emails for reference.
3. The brand voice of the client (which we can just scrape from their website)
4. The core features-benefits, solutions, etc. etc. of their product and company.

And the idea would then be to receive the output:

1. For each email, we receive the copy that synthesizes all of the above. (and then we would quality control it and adjust it as-needed).

---

Basically, we made the copy-writing easy for ourselves using our templated structure and examples... but it is still tedious and energy-consuming.

---

But instead of scouring the internet for a possible solution... we'd love to just chat with an expert in the field of AI (and/or email copy-wriitng) to help point us in the right direction faster! Please write "I am the copy-writing AI consultant you're looking for" as the first line of your application to let us know you've read the entire job post.

If this interests you, please apply! 

Cheers,
Jake

p.s. I have attached a screenshot of our "scaffolding" spreadsheet where we manually generate email copy based on a set structure and a generic example. (column A is the "section/goal", column C is the "generic copy example" to give us a base of knowledge, and column B is where we write the branded copy for that specific client)

I also made a loom video here for clearer context: https://www.loom.com/share/a6912a7ac6fc46e48aef381a9280c5af?sid=55512016-a6e0-4f2e-869f-4c28aede5830
Skills: ['Machine Learning', 'Email Copywriting', 'Email Design', 'Email Marketing', 'Email Marketing Strategy', 'Email Template Development', 'Copywriting', 'Generative AI', 'Generative AI Software', '+4']

Title: Call Center Modeling
Est. Time:

Description:
This notebook examines modeling a call center. Key Performance Parameters
The call center shall be able to handle on average at least 2 calls per minute.
The call center shall maintain a customer satisfaction score of greater than 5
A customer shall have no more than a 1% chance of the hold lines being full.
A customer shall have no more than a 1 min average hold time.
The call center shall have an availability greater than 0.999
The call center shall average maintenance cost per call shall be less than $0.015 
The purpose of this notebook is to use modeling and simulation to define the following derived system requirements. Each system requirement is mapped back to a KPP.
System Requirements:
-The call center shall have TBD inbound call hold lines.
-The call center shall have TBD agents (servers). 
Assumption: A phone call takes on an average 10 mins.

Title: Optimizing Warehouse Robotics Path with Reinforcement Learning
Est. Time:
Est. time:
     1 to 3 months, Less than 30 hrs/week
Description:
I'm looking for Reinforcement learning (RL) model creation and deployment, for a 4-way box shuttle, collision-free, warehouse.
Please review below short description below and the attached files. You may contact me for any queries.
The job includes end-to-end model creation and deployment under Linux with TCP/IP Socket to the host controller.
I like to receive a quotation, availability and timeline, as well as the outcome module deployment method.

Job includes:
    - model creation:	ent-to-end	
    - deployment OS:  Linux (Ubuntu 22.04 LTS)	
    - Interfaces:	         TCP/IP Socket	
			
Environment:			
    - 20 floors, 6 Aisle each, 60 Building Each, Double deep on both sides.		
    - 2 Box Inbound Lifts and 2 Box Outbound Lifts (4 in total). Each lift includes:		 
                2 conveyors within the lift	
                2 buffer conveyors on each floor (1..20)	
                2 buffer conveyors on the Inbound / Outbound floor (0).	
    - 2 Shuttle Lifts		
			
Generic rules :			
    - In case of 2 boxes at the buffer conveyor (Inbound/Floor): The lift should handle both boxes		
    - In case of a request to retrieve a "blocked box": 		
              if there is no pending task (retrieve/reshuffling) for the booking box - add a Reshuffling task (based on the Reshuffling strategy)	
              Always perform the Reshuffling task first	
			
Reinforcement inputs:			
    - Box inbound rate: 20 sec. in average (see parameters tab)		
    - Box Outbound rate: 20 sec. on average (see parameters tab)		
    - Reshuffling request rate: 600 sec. on average (see parameters tab)		
			
model deployment Inputs			
    - Setup parameters:	See the Parameters tab in the attached Excel file	
    - Runtime interface:	See the Parameters tab in the attached Excel file

Title: VertexAI .pb model to run outside of provided container.
Est. Time: N/A
Description:
I have trained a regression ML model for tabular data using AutoML from VertexAI. 

VertexAI lets you download it, and within the Docker container install an image provided by them to run the model locally. 

To communicate with the model container locally, the http protocol is used. 

However, I need the model .pb file to run outside of the container to minimize the latency.

I installed all libraries described in 'env.json' file that comes with the model files. 

However, I always end up with "KeyError:'DecodeProtoSparseV4" issue. 

Succesfull project has to include:
1. Calling the model without the use of Docker container
2. Inspecting why KeyError:'DecodeProtoSparseV4' shows up
3. If above are unsuccesful, I need you to find out whether creating a custom container with user chosen environment can help. 
4. Writing a documentation, so in the future I can reproduce the process on my own. 

Please, don't apply if you are unfamiliar with machine learning models, and/or VertexAI.
